pg13 1.0.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Summarize all Fields in a Schema

Source: R/summary.R
summarize_schema.Rd

summarize_field gets the total rows, distinct value count, valueset, and null counts for a single field in a table. To get the summary of more than 1 field, see summarize_fields. To summarize an entire table or schema without hand-selecting fields, see summarize_table and summarize_schema respectively.

summarize_schema(
  conn,
  conn_fun,
  schema,
  verbose = TRUE,
  render_sql = TRUE,
  render_only = FALSE,
  warn_no_rows = TRUE,
  ...
)

Examples

library(pg13)
create_test_schema <-
        function(conn) {

                if (!schema_exists(conn = conn,
                                   schema = "test_schema")) {

                        cli::cli_rule("Create 'test_schema' Schema")

                        create_schema(conn = conn,
                                      schema = "test_schema")

                }
        }


conn <- local_connect(dbname = "pg13_test")

#> Connecting using PostgreSQL driver
create_test_schema(conn = conn)

#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
write_table(conn = conn,
            schema = "test_schema",
            table_name = "test_table",
            drop_existing = TRUE,
            data = data.frame(A = 1:3, B = letters[1:3]))

#> [2020-12-20 17:45:25]	SQL: DROP TABLE IF EXISTS test_schema.test_table;
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:25]	Dropping...
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection

#> [2020-12-20 17:45:25]	Dropping...complete
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:25]	SQL: N/A
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:25]	Writing...
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:25]	Writing...complete

write_table(conn = conn,
            schema = "test_schema",
            table_name = "test_table2",
            drop_existing = TRUE,
            data = data.frame(C = rep(NA, 3), D = c(TRUE, FALSE, FALSE)))

write_table(conn = conn,
            schema = "test_schema",
            table_name = "test_table3",
            drop_existing = TRUE,
            data = data.frame(E = c(1.25, 343.31341, 5),
                              G = c(Sys.Date(), Sys.Date()-100, Sys.Date()-1000)))

summarize_fields(conn = conn, schema = "test_schema", table = "test_table", fields = c("A", "B"))

#> 1 3
#> 2 2
#> 3 1

#>   count

# Case is ignored
summarize_fields(conn = conn, schema = "test_schema", table = "test_table", fields = c("a", "b"))

# To summarize an entire table (all the fields without manually inputting them)
summarize_table(conn = conn, schema = "test_schema", table = "test_table3")

#> [2020-12-20 17:45:26]	SQL: N/A
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:26]	Listing Fields...
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:26]	Listing Fields...complete
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:26]	SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM test_schema.test_table3;

# An entire schema can also be summarized
summarize_schema(conn = conn, schema = "test_schema")

#> [2020-12-20 17:45:27]	SQL: N/A
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:27]	Listing Tables...

drop_schema(conn = conn,
            schema = "test_schema",
            cascade = TRUE)

#> Warning: 'drop_schema' is deprecated.
#> Use 'dropCascade' instead.
#> See help("Deprecated")
#> ── Checks ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 			
#> ✓ Open connection
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:28]	SQL: DROP SCHEMA IF EXISTS test_schema ;
#> [2020-12-20 17:45:28]	Sending...
#> Error in rJava::.jcall(statement, "V", "close"): org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: cannot drop schema test_schema because other objects depend on it
#>   Detail: table test_schema.test_table depends on schema test_schema
#> table test_schema.test_table2 depends on schema test_schema
#> table test_schema.test_table3 depends on schema test_schema
#>   Hint: Use DROP ... CASCADE to drop the dependent objects too.

dc(conn = conn)

#> [2020-12-20 17:45:28]	Postgres connection closed
